CDSB README

=Introduction=

This is CDSB version 1.0.

FreeBSD provides the binary compatibility with Linux, therefor some Cadence
products for Linux can be installed on FreeBSD.

CDSB attempts to do following to prepare to install Cadence products on
FreeBSD:

    Installing Ports

        accessibility/linux-atk

        graphics/linux-cairo

        textproc/linux-expat

        x11-fonts/linux-fontconfig

        devel/linux-glib2

        x11-toolkits/linux-gtk

        x11-toolkits/linux-gtk2

        graphics/linux-jpeg

        x11-toolkits/linux-pango

        graphics/linux-png

        sysutils/linux-procps

        graphics/linux-tiff

        x11/linux-xorg-libs

        emulators/linux_base-fc4

        archivers/rpm

    Installing RPMs

        audit-libs-0.8.2-1.i386.rpm

        cracklib-2.8.2-1.i386.rpm

        cracklib-dicts-2.8.2-1.i386.rpm

        gawk-3.1.4-5.i386.rpm

        gzip-1.3.5-6.i386.rpm

        less-382-7.i386.rpm

        mktemp-1.5-23.i386.rpm

        pam-0.79-8.i386.rpm

        pdksh-5.2.14-30.i386.rpm

        sed-4.1.4-1.i386.rpm

        tar-1.14-4.i386.rpm

        tcsh-6.14-1.i386.rpm

        util-linux-2.12p-9.3.i386.rpm

        Caution: The installed RPMs will be overwritten!

    Creating Directories

        /compat/linux/etc/rcCDS.d

    Creating Files

        /compat/linux/etc/rcCDS.d/README

        /usr/local/etc/rc.d/cdsrc

    Creating Links

        /compat/linux/bin/df -> /bin/df

        /compat/linux/usr/lib/librt.so.1 -> ../../lib/librt-2.3.6.so

    Adding Entries

        /etc/fstab:

            linproc /compat/linux/proc linprocfs rw 0 0

        /etc/shells:

            /compat/linux/bin/bash

            /compat/linux/bin/csh

            /compat/linux/bin/sh

            /compat/linux/bin/tcsh

            /compat/linux/usr/bin/ksh

            /copmat/linux/bin/ksh

            /copmat/linux/usr/bin/pdksh

    Mounting File Systems

        Linux Process File System

    Starting rc Scripts

        /etc/rc.d/abi

=Requirements=

1. Operating System

    FreeBSD-i386

2. Network Connections

    Need Network Connections to install Ports and RPMs.

3. The Ports Collection

    The Ports tree must be installed or updated.

=Usage=

1. Login as root.

2. Unpack the archives. Type:

    gzip -cd cdsb_1.0.tar.gz | tar xvf -

3. Run CDSB. Type:

    ./cdsb_1.0/bin/cdsb

=Recommendation=

1. Installing The Java Runtime Environment

    Cadence products usually contains the Java Runtime Environment. If it does
    not run correctly on FreeBSD, install the other version of the Java
    Runtime Environment, then create a link to point to it.

    For example, the Cadence installation program InstallScape contains the
    Java Runtime Environment in the iscape/runtime directory, named LNX86. To
    create a link, Type:

        mv LNX86 LNX86_bak
        ln -s path_to_jre LNX86

    The path_to_jre directory is the Java Runtime Environment installation
    directory.

2. Using Linux Shells

    To use Cadence products, Linux Shells are essential, for example,
    /compat/linux/bin/sh. Create an account that uses the Linux shell is
    recommended.

    To use the C shell, /compat/linux/bin/csh and /compat/linux/bin/tcsh, in
    order to locate the root directory correctly, add following to ~/.cshrc or
    ~/.tcshrc:

        set path=( $path \

                         /../../../sbin \
                         /../../../bin \
                         /../../../usr/sbin \
                         /../../../usr/bin \
                         /../../../usr/games \
                         /../../../usr/local/sbin \
                         /../../../usr/local/bin \
                         /../../../usr/X11R6/bin \
                      )

3. Using rc of Cadence products

    Cadence products provides several rc scripts to start daemons, for example,
    the license daemons. CDSB creates the /compat/linux/etc/rcCDS.d directory,
    put rc scripts in this directory. See the /compat/linux/etc/rcCDS.d/README
    file for details.
